quizzes.question: What two keywords do we need to create an array?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]JavaScript Arrays [/h1]

[b]Arrays [/b]store multiple values in a single variable. 

To store three course names, you need three variables.[code format="js" ]var course1 ="HTML"; 
var course2 ="CSS"; 
var course3 ="JS"; [/code]
But what if you had 500 courses? The solution is an [b]array[/b].[code format="js" ]var courses = [b]new Array[/b]("HTML", "CSS", "JS"); [/code]
[note]This syntax declares an array named [b]courses[/b], which stores three values, or elements.[/note]

[h1]Accessing an Array[/h1]

You refer to an array element by referring to the [b]index number[/b] written in [b]square brackets[/b].
This statement accesses the value of the first element in [b]courses [/b]and changes the value of the second element. [code format="js" ]var courses = new Array("HTML", "CSS", "JS"); 
var course = courses[b][0][/b]; // HTML
courses[b][1][/b] = "C++"; //Changes the second element [/code]
[note][0] is the first element in an array. [1] is the second. Array indexes start with [b]0[/b].[/note]
